title: How to Make Jalapeno Soup

steps.headline: Add 3 tablespoons of olive oil or half a teaspoon of ghee to a Cooking pan and let it heat for about 2 minutes on Medium flame.
Add chopped red onions to the oil and let the onions cook until they become translucent.
Add chopped green bell peppers to the pan and stir it for a minute until the peppers become semi-soft.
Add diced tomatoes or V8 to the mixture.
Chop the jalapeños and add them along with the Cilantro stems to the pan.
Add 1/3 tsp of cumin powder to the mixture and stir it all well for about 30 seconds.
Transfer the contents of the pan to a blender and add 1/4 cup of water or vegetable stock/broth to mix it all well.
Once the contents blend well into a paste, transfer the mixture onto another cooking pan.
Add 1 cup of water/vegetable stock to the mixture and let it come to a boil (This might take a couple of minutes for the all the flavors and stock to cook all the way through).
Add 3 tablespoons of sour cream (light) to get a creamy texture.
Add a little whipping cream to get a rich flavor.
Add just 1/3 tsp of lemon/lime juice on the top.
Keep stirring it till the mixture comes to a boil.
Add garlic croutons and your hot jalapeńo soup is ready to serve!

text: Add 3 tablespoons of olive oil or half a teaspoon of ghee to a Cooking pan and let it heat for about 2 minutes on Medium flame.  Add chopped red onions to the oil and let the onions cook until they become translucent.  Add chopped green bell peppers to the pan and stir it for a minute until the peppers become semi-soft.  Add diced tomatoes or V8 to the mixture.  Chop the jalapeños and add them along with the Cilantro stems to the pan. Stir it well. Add 1/3 tsp of cumin powder to the mixture and stir it all well for about 30 seconds.  Transfer the contents of the pan to a blender and add 1/4 cup of water or vegetable stock/broth to mix it all well.  Once the contents blend well into a paste, transfer the mixture onto another cooking pan.  Add 1 cup of water/vegetable stock to the mixture and let it come to a boil (This might take a couple of minutes for the all the flavors and stock to cook all the way through).  Add salt to taste.  Add 3 tablespoons of sour cream (light) to get a creamy texture.  Add a little whipping cream to get a rich flavor.  Add just 1/3 tsp of lemon/lime juice on the top.  Keep stirring it till the mixture comes to a boil.  Add garlic croutons and your hot jalapeńo soup is ready to serve!
